intro: Juanulloa membranacea, commonly known as the Juanulloa tree, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its woody structure and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, tropical environments and can reach heights of up to 15 meters. Its leaves are large, palmately lobed, and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are usually pink or red with five petals. Juanulloa membranacea plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
